200001.Name: Aabbt Kindred
200001.Card Text: Independent: Aabbt Kindred cannot perform directed actions unless /Nefertiti/ is ready. Aabbt Kindred can prevent 1 damage each combat. Non-unique.

200005.Name: Abdelsobek
200005.Card Text: Independent: Abdelsobek can unlock a vampire or mummy you control as a +1 stealth action.

200007.Name: Abid bin Haji, Scholar of Mirrors
200007.ASCII Name: Abid bin Haji, Scholar of Mirrors

200008.Name: Abiku
200008.Card Text: Laibon: Abiku gets +1 stealth when hunting.

200011.Name: Adana de Sforza
200011.Card Text: Camarilla Brujah Inner Circle: Combat cards cost Adana 1 fewer blood. +2 bleed.
200011.Title: inner circle

Rulings.text: Card with multiple types (eg. Combat/Action Modifer) are considered of the type they are played as, not both.

200013.Name: Adhiambo
200013.Card Text: Laibon: Adhiambo gets +1 stealth when equipping with a weapon from your hand and +1 stealth on actions to enter combat with other minions.

200014.Name: Adonai
200014.Card Text: Sabbat: Adonai can enter combat with any ready Camarilla vampire controlled by another Methuselah as a (D) action. He gets +1 strength when in combat with a Tremere. +1 bleed.

200015.Name: Adri, The Seeker
200015.Card Text: Independent: Adri gets +1 intercept against Ministers.

200017.Name: Aeron
200017.Card Text: Sabbat Archbishop of London: Minions opposing Aeron in combat take an additional point of damage during strike resolution if the range is close. Once each combat, Aeron may burn a blood for a press.
200017.Title: archbishop

Rulings.text: The damage inflicted by his ability is environmental.
His ability to get a press can only be used during the press step.
Damage is inflicted even against a dodge. A "strike: combat ends" ends combat before damage is applied, as will a combattant going to torpor during first strike.

200018.Name: Afifa, The Herald
200018.Card Text: Camarilla: When you put a Gehenna card in play, your prey burns 1 pool. If you do not put a Gehenna card in play during your discard phase, a ready vampire you control other than Afifa burns 1 blood, or you burn 1 pool.

200019.Name: Agaitas, The Scholar of Antiquities
200019.Card Text: Sabbat: When you play a card, you may draw its replacement from your prey's library instead of your own. Put the card drawn face-up in front of you. It is still considered to be in your hand, to be played or discarded as normal.

Rulings.text: Additional draws are not subject to his ability (eg. {Infernal Pursuit}, {Aura Reading}, {Learjet}).

If Agaitas is burned while cards owned by your prey are still face-up in front of you, you can still play and discard them as normal, but you cannot draw in your prey's library until you control Agaitas anew.
Cards from his ability that go into an ash heap, hand, or library always go into their owner's ash heap, hand, or library (eg. using {Heart of Nizchetus}).
A weapon available from his ability can be chosen for a {Concealed Weapon}.

200021.Name: Ági
200021.Card Text: Sabbat: Cards requiring Sanguinus [san] cost Ági 1 fewer blood. Budapest circle. Sterile.

200025.Name: Aidan Lyle
200025.Card Text: Camarilla: Aidan gets 1 optional press each combat.

200026.Name: Aimee Laroux
200026.Card Text: Independent: You may use four transfers and burn 1 pool to give Aimee an additional level of Melpominee [mel]. Aimee cannot play reaction cards.

200027.Name: Aimery Methuin
200027.Card Text: Sabbat: Younger Camarilla vampires get -1 intercept against Aimery.

200028.Name: Aisata Swanou
200028.Card Text: Laibon: During your master phase, you may draw a card and move a card from your hand to either your ash heap or the top of your library.

200029.Name: Aisha
200029.Card Text: Independent: Once each turn, Aisha can burn 1 blood to get +1 intercept for the current action.

Rulings.text: "Once each turn" means once during each player's turn.

200030.Name: Aisha az-Zahra
200030.Card Text: Anarch: During the polling step of any referendum, Aisha can burn 1 blood to get +1 vote for each ready anarch you control. +1 bleed.

200031.Name: Aisling Sturbridge
200031.Card Text: Camarilla: Younger Tremere cannot block Aisling.

200032.Name: Aiyana, The Wolfcatcher
200032.Card Text: Sabbat: Aiyana gets an optional press each combat when opposing a werewolf, and she can burn a blood each round to prevent all damage a werewolf inflicts on her that round. Sterile.

200033.Name: Akram
200033.Card Text: Camarilla primogen: Once each turn after completing combat, if Akram and the opposing minion are still ready, Akram may burn 1 blood to begin another combat with the opposing minion.
200033.Title: primogen

Rulings.text: If his ability is used to start a new combat, effects that end combat and then do something else after combat (include continuing the action as if unblocked) will be lost, except for unlock effects.
His ability cannot be used to start a new combat if there is already a pending combat queued.
"Once each turn" means once during each player's turn.

200034.Name: Aksinya Daclau
200034.Card Text: Sabbat: Once each turn during a bleed against you, if Aksinya is ready and unlocked, you may discard a master card from your hand to redirect the bleed to any other Methuselah.

Rulings.text: "Once each turn" means once during each player's turn.

200035.Name: Al-Ashrad, Amr of Alamut
200035.Card Text: Independent: Al-Ashrad can burn a location requiring a clan as a (D) action that costs 2 blood. Blood cursed. +1 bleed.

200036.Name: Al-Ashrad, Amr of Alamut
200036.Card Text:
Camarilla: During the first round of combat, Al-Ashrad can use strikes requiring Blood Sorcery [tha] that are not usable during the first round. Blood cursed.
[MERGED] Banu Haqim Inner Circle: +1 bleed.

200037.Name: Al-Muntaquim, The Avenger
200037.Card Text: Independent: During your unlock phase, you may burn a Caitiff you control to give Al-Muntaquim +1 bleed for the remainder of the game. Al-Muntaquim unlocks whenever a Gehenna card is played. He cannot use cards that require Celerity [cel]. Scarce.

200038.Name: Al-Muntathir, God's Witness
200038.Card Text: Sabbat: If you control four or more True Brujah, burn Al-Muntathir. He cannot use cards requiring Celerity [cel]. Black Hand. Scarce.

Rulings.text: Black Hand is not a title, it is a trait unrelated to any sect. The trait is not lost if the vampire changes sect.

200039.Name: Alabástrom
200039.Card Text: Anarch: If Alabástrom is ready during your turn, you can unlock another ready Gargoyle you control. Flight [FLIGHT].

200040.Name: Alan Sovereign
200040.Card Text: Camarilla: When you play an investment card, add an additional counter to it from the blood bank.

200041.Name: Alan Sovereign
200041.Card Text:
Advanced, Camarilla: While Alan is ready, you may pay some or all of the pool cost of equipping from any investment cards you control.
[MERGED] During your master phase, if Alan is ready, you may move a counter from any investment card to your pool.

200042.Name: Alcoan
200042.Card Text: Sabbat: If Alcoan is in combat with an ally or younger vampire, you can look at the opposing minion's controller's hand before range is determined during the first round.

200043.Name: Aleister Crowley
200043.Card Text: Camarilla: Frenzy cards cannot be played on Aleister.

200044.Name: Alejandro Aguirre
200044.Card Text: Sabbat: If Alejandro is ready, he may lock before range is determined in any combat that does not involve him to inflict 1 unpreventable damage on each combatant.

Rulings.text: If a card transforms the damage he inflicts to aggravated (eg. {True Faith}), this includes the damage from his ability.

200046.Name: Alessandro Garcia
200046.Card Text: Sabbat: Alessandro gets +1 strength in combat with a Lasombra.

200047.Name: Alex Camille
200047.Card Text: Sabbat: During an action, Alex can burn 1 blood to get +1 intercept.

200048.Name: Alex Wilkins
200048.Card Text: Camarilla: If Alex successfully bleeds, the target Methuselah can burn 1 additional pool to steal him after resolution.

201529.Name: Alexa Draper
201529.Card Text: Camarilla Prince of Melbourne: During the polling step of any referendum, Alexa can discard 1 card requiring Dominate [dom] to get +1 vote.
201529.Title: prince

201530.Name: Alexander Silverson
201530.Card Text: Camarilla Prince of Birmingham: Vampires must burn 1 blood to cast votes and ballots against referendums called by Alexander.
201530.Title: prince

200049.Name: Alexandra
200049.Card Text: Camarilla Toreador Inner Circle: Once during your turn, you may lock or unlock another ready Toreador. +2 bleed.
200049.Title: inner circle

Rulings.text: Can use her unlock ability at any point during the turn, including during a political action.
If she locks a Toreador who was attempting to block, then that block will fail.
Her ability can be used when in torpor.

200050.Name: Alexis Sorokin
200050.Card Text: Independent: Once each combat, Alexis can strike: dodge. She can steal an equipment as a (D) action. She gets +1 bleed against a Methuselah who controls a ready Toreador. Red List.

200051.Name: Alfred Benezri
200051.Card Text: Sabbat bishop: Alfred gets -1 strength in combat with an ally.
200051.Title: bishop

200052.Name: Alfred Benezri
200052.Card Text:
Advanced, Sabbat bishop: If Alfred is ready, he may lock before range is determined to end combat between two other Sabbat vampires.
[MERGED] Archbishop of Montreal: Once each referendum, he may burn 1 blood to gain 1 vote.
200052.Title: bishop

200054.Name: Alicia Barrows
200054.Card Text: Sabbat Archbishop of Mexico City: If you control the Edge during your unlock phase, you may look at the hand of another Methuselah and discard up to two Gehenna cards from it.
200054.Title: archbishop

201575.Name: Alicia Cortez
201575.Card Text: Camarilla Prince of Tampa: After Alicia performs a successful directed action, she can discard a political action card to lock a younger vampire controlled by (one of) the target Methuselah(s).
201575.Title: prince

201576.Name: Aline Gädeke
201576.Card Text: Anarch Baron of Mannheim: Once each turn, Aline can burn 1 blood to unlock after another Anarch you control performs a successful action.
201576.Title: baron

200057.Name: Allonzo Montoya
200057.Card Text: Independent: Allonzo gets +1 stealth on actions that require Serpentis [ser]. Allonzo cannot block undirected actions. Scarce. Sterile.

200060.Name: Alonso Petrodon
200060.Card Text: Camarilla Nosferatu Justicar: Alonso inflicts 1 unpreventable damage on each anarch controlled by the target of the bleed after bleeding successfully. +1 bleed.
200060.Title: justicar

200061.Name: Alonzo Guillen
200061.Card Text: Camarilla: During your unlock phase and your discard phase, if Alonzo is ready, you may burn the Edge to look at another Methuselah's hand.

200063.Name: Alvaro, The Scion of Angelica
200063.Card Text: Sabbat Archbishop of Pittsburgh: After resolution of any political action, if Alvaro abstained (even in torpor), he can gain 2 blood. +1 bleed.
200063.Title: archbishop

Rulings.text: He gains blood if he casts no vote, even if he has lost his title or is in torpor.
The hunt bonus applies to non-standard hunt actions, blood comes from the target of the hunt.

200065.Name: Amaravati
200065.Card Text: Independent: During the polling step of a political action, Amaravati can burn 2 blood to give each ready Banu Haqim you control +1 vote. Blood cursed.

Rulings.text: Keeps his title and votes if he changes sects.

200069.Name: Ambrogino Giovanni
200069.Card Text:
Independent: During your unlock phase, Ambrogino can remove seven cards in your ash heap from the game to gain 2 blood. Red List. +1 bleed.
[MERGED] +1 stealth.

200070.Name: Ambrosio Luis Monçada, Plenipotentiary
200070.Card Text: Sabbat cardinal: Monçada cannot block. Actions directed at him cost 1 additional pool. If he is ready during your discard phase, you can unlock another ready Lasombra.
200070.Title: cardinal

200071.Name: Amelia
200071.Card Text: Sabbat bishop: Amelia can enter combat with any vampire of capacity below 4 controlled by another Methuselah as a +1 stealth (D) action.
200071.Title: bishop

200072.Name: Amelia, The Blood Red Tears
200072.Card Text: Camarilla: After combat with Amelia, the opposing minion burns 1 blood or life.

Rulings.text: Her ability triggers after combat if she's still in play, even in torpor. If she is burned during combat, it does not trigger.
If multiple combats occur in the same action, the opposing minion burns 1 blood or life each time the combat ends.
In the case of {Free Fight}, the last opposing minion burns the blood.

200073.Name: Amenophobis
200073.Card Text: Camarilla primogen: You can draw 1 card (discard down afterward) after resolution of any successful action requiring Serpentis [ser]. Amenophobis gets +1 bleed against the Methuselah who has the Edge.
200073.Title: primogen

200074.Name: Amisa
200074.Card Text: Independent. 2 votes (titled): Amisa can lock a vampire with capacity 8 or more as a (D) action.
200074.Title: 2 votes

Rulings.text: Keeps her title and votes if she changes sects.

200076.Name: Anarch Convert
200076.Card Text: Anarch: As the convert enters play, you can remove him from the game to make a non-titled vampire you control Anarch and either gain 1 pool or draw 1 card from your crypt.

Rulings.text: His "as he enters play" ability can be used before he enters contest if there is another one in play.
Can "convert" an already anarch vampire if he is not titled.

200078.Name: Anastasz di Zagreb
200078.Card Text: Camarilla Tremere Justicar: If there are any other justicars ready, Anastasz gets 1 fewer vote from his justicar title. Anastasz may steal 1 blood as a ranged strike.
200078.Title: justicar

200079.Name: Anatole, Prophet of Gehenna
200079.Card Text: Camarilla: If Anatole is ready during your master phase, you may look at the top 5 cards of your library and then shuffle the top 5 cards of your library. +1 intercept.

200080.Name: Andre LeRoux
200080.Card Text: Camarilla: If a vampire you control would successfully bleed, you can reduce the bleed amount by 1 to give Andre +2 bleed this turn.

Rulings.text: His ability can be used only once per successful bleed, but can be used multiple times on different bleeds during the same turn.
It is used in the "would/about to be successful" window like {Spying Mission}.
Only modifiers and reactions that can be played "when the action/bleed would be successful" can be played after it.
He can use his ability on his own bleed to get (-1 +2) = +1 bleed.
His ability cannot be used after {Spying Mission}. If his ability reduces a bleed to zero, it is no longer successful and {Spying Mission} cannot be used afterwards.

200081.Name: André the Manipulator
200081.Card Text: Camarilla: While André is ready, you get +2 hand size.

200082.Name: Andrea Giovanni
200082.Card Text: Independent: Andrea gets +1 stealth during actions requiring Necromancy [nec].

200083.Name: Andreas, The Bard of Crete
200083.Card Text: Camarilla primogen: Once each turn, Andreas may burn 1 blood to get +1 intercept for the current action.
200083.Title: primogen

Rulings.text: "Once each turn" means once during each player's turn.

200086.Name: Andrew Stuart
200086.Card Text: Camarilla: As Andrew plays a card requiring Blood Sorcery [tha] (before replacing the card), reveal the top card of your library. If it also requires Blood Sorcery, the card played is canceled and Andrew burns 1 blood.

200087.Name: Andy
200087.Card Text: Camarilla: An older vampire opposing Andy gets one optional press each combat.

200090.Name: Angela Decker
200090.Card Text: Sabbat: If Angela is burned in combat, burn 2 pool.

200091.Name: Angela Preston
200091.Card Text: Camarilla: Angela must burn 1 blood to attempt to block an older vampire. You may lock Angela during your influence phase to unlock any other vampire.

Rulings.text: When she is influenced out, her ability to unlock a vampire can be used during the ongoing influence phase.
Her ability can be used when in torpor.

200092.Name: Angelica, The Canonicus
200092.Card Text: Sabbat cardinal: During an action, Angelica can discard X master cards to get +X intercept.
200092.Title: cardinal

200093.Name: Angelique
200093.Card Text: Sabbat: While Angelique is ready, cards requiring Necromancy [nec] cost Harbingers of Skulls you control 1 fewer blood.

200094.Name: Angelo
200094.Card Text: Independent. Red List: All Blood Brothers may play cards that require Sanguinus [san] as if Angelo were a member of any circle. Angelo can burn a location as a (D) action. He cannot have or use retainers. Sterile.

Rulings.text: A vampire with no circle designation is in his own unique circle of one. Angelo cannot be seen as a member of such a circle.
He cannot attempt an action to employ a retainer, nor strike to steal a retainer.

200096.Name: Anisa Marianna Lopez
200096.Card Text: Sabbat: Anisa can burn a vampire with a capacity less than 4 controlled by your predator or prey as a (D) action that costs 1 pool.

200098.Name: Anka, Priestess of Thorns
200098.Card Text: Sabbat: Anka can enter combat with a Lasombra as a (D) action.

200100.Name: Ankla Hotep
200100.Card Text: Independent: Rescuing Ankla from torpor costs 2 fewer blood. He gets 1 optional press each combat.

200101.Name: Ankou, The
200101.Card Text: Camarilla: If any vampire successfully hunts while the Ankou is ready and unlocked, the Ankou can burn that vampire as a (D) action that turn (even on another Methuselah's turn).

200102.Name: Anna "Dictatrix11" Suljic
200102.Card Text: Anna may move 2 blood from the blood bank to any vampire as a +1 stealth action. During your unlock phase, you may look at the top three cards of your library.

200103.Name: Annabelle Triabell
200103.Card Text: Camarilla primogen: Annabelle can give Toreador vampires +1 bleed for the remainder of the turn as a +1 stealth action that costs 1 blood. If that action is successful, Annabelle unlocks.
200103.Title: primogen

Rulings.text: Her ability applies to all Toreadors, not just the ones in play at the time the action resolved.

200104.Name: Annazir
200104.Card Text: Independent. 2 votes (titled): Annazir can burn a location or steal an equipment as a (D) action. Infernal. +1 bleed.
200104.Title: 2 votes

Rulings.text: Keeps his title and votes if he changes sects.

200105.Name: Anne-Marie Bourgeois, Inconnu Recruiter
200105.Card Text: Camarilla: Equipment costs Anne-Marie 1 fewer pool.

200106.Name: Anneke
200106.Card Text: Camarilla Toreador Justicar: Anneke may attempt to block a vampire controlled by another Methuselah, ignoring the normal prey, predator or target restrictions for blocking actions. +1 bleed.
200106.Title: justicar

Rulings.text: Her ability only affects the rule restricting who gets to block an action. She must still meet all other requirements to block. In particular, {Blood Bond}, {Day Operation}, {Seduction} and prior decision not to block are not circumvented.

200107.Name: Anson
200107.Card Text: Camarilla Prince of Seattle: If Anson is ready during your master phase, you get two master phase actions (instead of one).
200107.Title: prince

200108.Name: Antara
200108.Card Text: Independent: Antara gets +1 intercept against Sabbat vampires. He burns 1 blood after any Methuselah plays a Gehenna event. Blood cursed.

200111.Name: Antoinette Dubois
200111.Card Text: Independent: Toreador and Toreador antitribu cannot block Antoinette. -1 intercept.

200112.Name: Antoinette DuChamp
200112.Card Text: Camarilla: Action cards and strike cards that require Celerity [cel] cost Antoinette an additional blood.

200114.Name: Antón de Concepción
200114.Card Text: Sabbat Archbishop of Chicago: Antón gets 1 optional maneuver during the first round of combat.
200114.Title: archbishop

200115.Name: Antonino
200115.Card Text: Independent: Antonino gets +1 stealth on undirected actions.

200116.Name: Antonio d'Erlette
200116.Card Text: Sabbat: While Antonio is ready, you can use 4 transfers to search your library (shuffle afterward) and/or hand for a mage ally he could play. Put that ally in play with life equal to its starting life and pay its cost as normal.

200117.Name: Antonio Delgado
200117.Card Text: Sabbat Archbishop of Atlanta: If Antonio performs a political action whose referendum passes, he can unlock during the discard phase.
200117.Title: archbishop

200118.Name: Antonio Veradas
200118.Card Text: Sabbat bishop: Antonio gets +1 stealth when equipping with a weapon. During your discard phase, Antonio may burn 1 blood to unlock.
200118.Title: bishop

200119.Name: Anu Diptinatpa
200119.Card Text: Independent: During a bleed action, Anu can burn 1 blood to give the acting minion +1 bleed. Scarce.

200123.Name: Apolonia Czarnecki
200123.Card Text: Camarilla: Apolonia can steal 1 blood from a younger vampire as a (D) action.

Rulings.text: Black Hand is not a title, it is a trait unrelated to any sect. The trait is not lost if the vampire changes sect.

200125.Name: Appolonius
200125.Card Text: Camarilla primogen: Appolonius gets one optional press each combat. +1 bleed.
200125.Title: primogen

200126.Name: Appolonius
200126.Card Text:
Anarch: Appolonius gets +1 bleed for each titled vampire controlled by the target Methuselah.
[MERGED] Baron of London: Appolonius can enter combat with a minion as a (D) action.

200127.Name: Arcadian, The
200127.Card Text: Sabbat: The Arcadian can bleed with +1 bleed as a +1 stealth (D) action that costs 1 blood.

200128.Name: Ardan Lane
200128.Card Text: Camarilla primogen: When stealing blood with a strike that requires Blood Sorcery [tha], Ardan steals an additional blood.
200128.Title: primogen

Rulings.text: Black Hand is not a title, it is a trait unrelated to any sect. The trait is not lost if the vampire changes sect.

200130.Name: Aren, Priest of Eshu
200130.Card Text: Laibon: Aren gets +1 stealth on political actions. Any vampire casting votes or ballots against a referendum called by Aren burns 1 blood when the results are tallied.

200131.Name: Ariadne
200131.Card Text: Camarilla: Blood hunts cannot be called on Ariadne. +1 hunt.

Rulings.text: The hunt bonus applies to non-standard hunt actions, blood comes from the target of the hunt.

200132.Name: Ariane
200132.Card Text: Anarch: Ariane gets -1 stealth during undirected actions.

200133.Name: Arianne, The Conqueror
200133.Card Text: Sabbat: On any round after the first, Arianne may strike to end combat and inflict 1 damage on the opposing minion after combat ends.

200135.Name: Arika
200135.Card Text: Camarilla Ventrue Inner Circle: If Arika is ready during your prey's unlock phase, your prey chooses which locations he or she keeps in play. For each location he or she controls, your prey burns 1 pool or burns the location. +2 bleed.
200135.Title: inner circle

Rulings.text: Arika's prey can use a location during her unlock phase before burning it.
Arika's prey cannot end her unlock phase if she controls a location that she hasn't burned a pool for, even if she gained control of that location during that unlock phase.

200136.Name: Arishat
200136.Card Text: Independent. 1 vote (titled): During the polling step of any referendum, Arishat can burn 1 blood to force any vampire to abstain. Infernal.
200136.Title: 1 vote

Rulings.text: Her ability applies to Priscus votes and ballots.
Her ability to force a vampire to abstain can cancel the votes and ballots of the vampire.
Keeps her title and votes if she changes sects.

200137.Name: Aristotle de Laurent
200137.Card Text: Sabbat: While Aristotle is ready, every Methuselah has +1 hand size. +1 stealth.

200138.Name: Armin Brenner
200138.Card Text: Sabbat Archbishop of Washington, D.C.: When a referendum Armin calls passes, you gain 1 pool after resolving the referendum.
200138.Title: archbishop

Rulings.text: His ability is applied after the referendum effects are applied, including any oust and pool gained from it.

200140.Name: Arnulf Jormungandrsson
200140.Card Text: Camarilla: If Arnulf attempts to block, the acting minion cannot play action modifier cards requiring Dementation [dem], Dominate [dom], Necromancy [nec] or Presence [pre] until the end of the action.

200141.Name: Arriette Sylla
200141.Card Text: Laibon: If Arriette has no /Orun/, she gets -1 bleed.

200142.Name: Art Morgan
200142.Card Text: Camarilla primogen: If Art is ready during your minion phase, you can unlock a werewolf you control.
200142.Title: primogen

200145.Name: Asguresh
200145.Card Text: Independent: During a combat, Asguresh can cancel a combat card played by the opposing minion as it is played, and its cost is not paid. Scarce.

Rulings.text: If his ability is used to cancel a strike, another strike is chosen.
If a canceled card had a "Do Not Replace Until" clause on it (or alternate replacement like {Steely Tenacity}), that clause is canceled as well and the card is replaced normally.
If his ability is used to cancel a limited effect (additional strike), then the limit is not triggered and another limited effect can be used.
Can only cancel minion cards played from the hand in the normal fashion (eg. not weapons played via {Disguised Weapon}).

200146.Name: Ash Harrison
200146.Card Text: Sabbat. Black Hand: Once each round, if the range is long, Ash may strike for 1R aggravated damage.

Rulings.text: Black Hand is not a title, it is a trait unrelated to any sect. The trait is not lost if the vampire changes sect.

200147.Name: Assad Salhoum
200147.Card Text: Camarilla: When Assad successfully blocks, he gains 1 blood from the blood bank (before combat begins, if any).

200148.Name: Astrid Thomas
200148.Card Text: Camarilla primogen: When results are tallied during a referendum, any Tremere who are not abstaining cast votes and ballots with Astrid (unless Astrid abstains).
200148.Title: primogen

Rulings.text: Her ability triggers when votes are tallied.
Tremere who have not yet voted can choose to abstain.
If her votes are canceled, the other Tremere votes are unaffected by her ability.

200149.Name: Augustus Giovanni
200149.Card Text: Independent. 2 votes (titled): If a vampire you control has been burned since your last turn, Augustus can move that vampire from your ash heap to the ready region (with no blood) as an action that costs 1 pool. +1 bleed.
200149.Title: 2 votes

Rulings.text: Keeps his title and votes if he changes sects.

200152.Name: Ayelea, The Manipulator
200152.Card Text: Sabbat cardinal: Ayelea may give you control of a Tremere antitribu until the end of your next turn as a (D) action.
200152.Title: cardinal

200153.Name: Ayo Igoli
200153.Card Text: Laibon: Ayo gets an additional vote for each ready titled vampire you control. You may use a discard phase action to move 2 blood from Ayo to a Laibon in your uncontrolled region.

200154.Name: Azaneal
200154.Card Text: Independent: Actions to put vampires in play cost Azaneal 1 less blood or pool. Infernal.

200155.Name: Aziz, Dammar of Istanbul
200155.Card Text: Independent. 2 votes (titled): Put 1 status counter on Aziz after a vampire opposing him is burned in combat. He gets +1 vote for each status counter on him. Blood cursed. +1 strength.
200155.Title: 2 votes

Rulings.text: Keeps his title and votes if he changes sects.

200156.Name: Azrael
200156.Card Text: Sabbat: Azrael can move 1 of the blood he would gain from a hunt to another vampire you control instead. He cannot press to end combat.

200157.Name: Baba Yaga, the Iron Hag
200157.Card Text: Independent: Once each turn, Baba Yaga can unlock when she successfully recruits an ally or employs a retainer. Once each round, she can burn 1 blood to make the damage from her hand strikes aggravated that round. +1 strength. +1 bleed.

Rulings.text: Her ability applies when recruiting in a non-normal way (eg. {Pack Alpha}).
"Once each turn" means once during each player's turn.

200158.Name: Babalawo Alafin
200158.Card Text: Laibon: During your unlock phase, if Alafin is ready, you may discard two cards (draw afterward). If the two cards are the same, each other Methuselah's hand size is one card smaller until his or her next unlock phase.

200160.Name: Badr, Shadow of Granada

When playing a card requiring a sect and/or a clan, she is treated as a such for all effects of the card, and only them, including duration effects. She is not treated as such for effects the card has from being in play.
When playing a card requiring a sect, her title makes her a titled vampire of that sect (eg. she can play {Hand Intervention}).

If her capacity is above 10 when playing {Call the Great Beast}, she burns and it is put into play. If her capacity is less, the card is put on her with tokens equal to her capacity, but she will not be able to add counters to it later on.
You can still use the burn options of cards with a requirement she could meet when you play them, but does not meet while in play.

201446.Name: Vidal Jarbeaux
201446.Card Text: Camarilla: Vidal can meet the clan, sect, or non-infernal vampire trait (e.g., Black Hand) requirement to play any card. He can meet a given requirement only once each game. +1 bleed.

Rulings.text: When meeting a requirement to play a card, he is treated as such for all the effects of the card, and only them, including duration effects. He is not treated as meeting the requirements for effects the card has from being in play.
If a card he plays is canceled as it is played, he is still considered having used the requirement, if any.
He can meet any title as well as non-requirements (eg. non-Red List), but cannot meet requirements that are not vampire traits (eg. Mortal, unlocked, older, ..)
When meeting a title requirement, he is considered as a vampire of the underlying sect.
He can meet the requirements for his controller to play any card, including Master cards.
He cannot fulfill a non-vampire trait requirement (eg. Gehenna), but he can fulfill the "Red List" or "Flight" requirements.
Striga and Maleficia are not vampire traits.
When meeting a requirement, the controller can choose how he meets it (eg. he can play {Anarch Secession} as a Prince of any city, even a made-up one).
He can meet a given generic requirement (eg. Prince) only once, however he decides to meet it (eg. city choice).
He must choose a title when playing a card required a "titled" vampire (eg. {Rubicon}), but can only choose each title once. He can choose the non-descript "X votes" title, but only once.

201456.Card Text: Independent: Vlad uses and can play cards requiring a title or a sect as if he had that required title or were of that required sect. +1 bleed.

Rulings.text: When playing a card requiring a title or a sect, he is treated as a such for all effects of the card, including duration effects. (eg. he can {Archon} himself and use its effect later)
He can use {No Secrets From the Magaji} to attempt to block a vampire acting with no stealth. REVERSAL from previous rulings.
His ability do not let him fulfill card requirements if they are not played normally, like when using {Piper} to recruit an ally.
When meeting a title requirement, he is considered as a vampire of the underlying sect.
When meeting a requirement, the controller can choose how he meets it (eg. he can play {Anarch Secession} as a Prince of any city, even a made-up one).
He can use a card requiring a sect or titled to be played (eg. use {Abbot} intercept bonus as a Sabbat vampire, perform {Archon} action to burn it as a Prince or Justicar).
He cannot use a card as a vampire of a sect or with a title if the card does not require the sect or title to be played. (eg. he cannot benefit from {Powerbase: Madrid} as a Sabbat vampire)

201463.Name: Wamukota
201463.Card Text: Laibon: If another Laibon you control is blocked while equipping, recruiting, or employing, you can lock Wamukota before block resolution to lock the blocking minion and have that Laibon continue the action as if unblocked. +1 bleed.

Rulings.text: If the action continues "as if unblocked", all action modifiers and reaction cards are still in effect, even those pertaining to a successful block.
If the action continues "as if unblocked", Methuselah that had declined to block before do not get another opportunity to block.

"continue as if unblocked" moves the action card from the ash heap (where it went when the action was blocked) to limbo (where it should be if the action is not blocked). If the action card is not in the ash heap, then the action cannot be continued.
His ability to end combat can be used when he is in torpor.
